name: Fédération européenne des industries des aliments pour animaux familiers
goal:
1. The aim of the Association shall be to carry out studies, particularly in the scientific, technical, institutional and legal fields, on all matters of concern to the pet food industry.

The specific objective is international economic integration, especially within the European Union, and also research and the implementation of the solutions resulting from that research.

2. Its activities shall consist of carrying out studies, making contacts, carrying out negotiations and transactions, in the interests of its members. It shall therefore rely basically on the co-operation and/or co-ordination of its members’ activities. The Association shall represent its members before the authorities of the European Union and before other international institutions and associations.

3. The Association aims to promote a favourable, non-discriminatory regulatory environment for the European pet food industry, either through legislation or voluntarily accepted rules.

• set up co-operation, information exchange and assistance amongst the Members and Observers, with a view to establishing expert views for discussion with the institutions of the European Union and, in particular, with the European Commission, and representative international organizations which may be involved;
• contribute to the advancement of research on regulatory issues;
• establish coherent and expert knowledge and analysis such that the institutions with which Members wish to hold discussion naturally consult the Members at a formative stage in policy development;
• provide a framework for the discussion of regulatory issues and exchange of experience;
• provide the necessary elements for the development of regulation in the fields of pet food;
• promote and provide training;
• cultivate relations with similar associations outside Europe;
• work together, where possible, to establish common policies among Members and Observers towards agreed issues; and
• share the knowledge and expertise acquired in Europe in respect of pet food regulation with authorities, organisations or associations from countries situated outside of the European Union, on its own or through entities it cooperates with.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Consumers, Economy, finance and the euro, Environment, Food Safety, Public Health, Research and innovation, Trade
